intro: Leandra gardneriana var. setulosa, commonly known as the silky leandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
